Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the tracking capabilities of Apple and Google's COVID-19 Exposure Notification System by stating that they are secretly tracking users.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that Apple and Google are secretly tracking users.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the COVID-19 Exposure Notification System is automatically turned on and tracks everywhere users go, without providing evidence to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation by stating that the COVID-19 Exposure Notification System is optional and uses Bluetooth to pair with official contact tracing apps, without collecting or using location data.
